page.title: 01Overview of Study Area
page.content: The study area consists of the southern half of the Island of Portland in Dorset. The Island is in fact a peninsula connected to the mainland at its northern end by the magnificent bank of shingle known as Chesil Beach. The total population of the Isle of Portland is in the region of 15,000 of which about 10,000 live in the three main settlements covered by this study i.e. the villages of Easton, Weston and Southwell. Large areas of the Island have been opened up by the quarrying industry extracting Portland limestone for local use and for sale elsewhere. This stone has been used in the construction of several important buildings in London. Other industries on the Island relate to fishing, the Navy and Ministry of Defence establishments.
